questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a GA diagram in a process plant?

answers.a: To show the detailed piping layout
answers.b: To illustrate the process flow diagram
answers.c: To provide a general overview of the plant layout
answers.d: To specify the instrumentation and control systems

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically included in a GA diagram?
What is the benefit of using a GA diagram in process plant design?

answers.a: It reduces the cost of plant construction

questions.question: Who is typically responsible for developing a GA diagram?
What is the relationship between a GA diagram and a PFD (Process Flow Diagram)?

answers.a: A GA diagram is a detailed version of a PFD
answers.b: A PFD is a simplified version of a GA diagram
answers.c: A GA diagram shows the plant layout, while a PFD shows the process flow
answers.d: A GA diagram and PFD are unrelated

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration when developing a GA diagram?
What is the typical scale of a GA diagram?
Which software is commonly used to develop a GA diagram?
What is the benefit of using a GA diagram during plant operation and maintenance?
How often should a GA diagram be updated?
